page.title: 02GROWTH OF WORKSOP
page.content: Worksop probably predates a Saxon settlement on the south side of the Ryton valley. Radford Priory was founded in 1103 and gave rise to the community of Radford. The population of the market town of Worksop increased dramatically in the 17th. and 18th. centuries as a result of the opening of the Chesterfield Canal in 1777 and the change of emphasis of local industry from malting, milling, timber working and liquorice growing to coal mining. Manton colliery was sunk in 1898 and is today a major employer in the town. Worksop station was built in 1849. Mains water was provided in 1878 and the sewage works was completed in 1881. Worksop is today Bassetlaw's largest town with a population of 30,000 plus.
